dt-option.name: orderCellsTop
dt-option.summary: Control which cell the order event handler will be applied to in a column
dt-option.deprecated:
As of DataTables 2 the default option for this parameter has changed to `null` rather than the previous `false` in 1.x. The result is that all cells in the header will have a sort listener attached and icons shown. You can set this value to `false` to have the same behaviour as v1.x.
This property is not very flexible, being able to specify the top or bottom rows only. In DataTables 2 is it superseded by the `data-dt-order` attribute for the `-tag tr` and / or `-tag th` elements in the `-tag thead` of the table. See `-init columns.orderable` for further details.
dt-option.description: Allows control over whether DataTables should use the top (`true`) unique cell that is found for a single column, or the bottom (`false`) to attach the default order listener and display sorting icons. This can be useful when using complex headers. As of DataTables 2, if the value of this parameter is given as `null` (which it is by default) all cells in the header will automatically have the sort listener attached and icons shown. Consider for example the following HTML header: ```html 1 2.1 2.2 ``` In this case, when `dt-init orderCellsTop` is `false` the cells `-string 1` and `-string 2.2` will have the order event listener applied to them. If `dt-init orderCellsTop` is `true` then `-string 1` and `-string 2.1` will have the order event listeners applied to them. Finally, if the value is given is `null` (default), all cells will have the ordering event listeners attached.

example.title: Use the top cells in a complex header for ordering
